Posted By: Iserp (8/22/2009 7:59:30 AM)

posts.post_content:
@ Hovercraft  
You do NOT need to destroy Illusions, the beauty of it is that the Cumulative Upkeep will eventually force your opponent to sacrifice it, triggering its Leaves the Battlefield ability.  
  
You could abuse it by bouncing it back to your hand after donating, allowing you to cast it again for 20 more life, and another shot at donating it to someone else.
posts.html:
@ Hovercraft

You could abuse it by bouncing it back to your hand after donating, allowing you to cast it again for 20 more life, and another shot at donating it to someone else.

Posted By: Atali (2/18/2011 9:37:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"Look at Bazaar Trader again; it cannot give away enchantments. I have to wonder if this was a conscious decision"*  
~scumbling1  
  
Yes and No, yes because red just isn't part of the color pie that interacts with enchantments much, so it suits red's flavor to exclude enchantments. No because that combo wouldn't have been overly powerful, it can be bounced, griped, ect. in response to the gain 20 life trigger.   
  
The Mono-red cards that interact with enchantments and don't require off color mana requirements are:  
[Goblin Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Tutor)  
[Aura Barbs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aura Barbs)  
[Blood Oath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Oath)  
[Confusion in the Ranks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confusion in the Ranks)  
[Warp World](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warp World) Somewhat, only to a small extent so that auras can still be placed on things.   
  
And then... there is [Wild Swing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Swing).
posts.html:
"Look at Bazaar Trader again; it cannot give away enchantments. I have to wonder if this was a conscious decision"
~scumbling1

Yes and No, yes because red just isn't part of the color pie that interacts with enchantments much, so it suits red's flavor to exclude enchantments. No because that combo wouldn't have been overly powerful, it can be bounced, griped, ect. in response to the gain 20 life trigger.

The Mono-red cards that interact with enchantments and don't require off color mana requirements are:
Goblin Tutor
Aura Barbs
Blood Oath
Confusion in the Ranks
Warp World Somewhat, only to a small extent so that auras can still be placed on things.

And then... there is Wild Swing.

posts.post_content:
Why not just play it, decline to pay the cumulative upkeep, and [Stifle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stifle) the LtB effect?
  
   
Probably because life gain sucks, and it's much cooler to actually kill your opponent with it.
  
   
Still, could be a big boon in a [Felidar Sovereign](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Felidar Sovereign) deck, seeing as you get a huge boost and the Sovereign triggers before you need to pay the upkeep.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Play it, kill it, sac [Children of Korlis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Children of Korlis) Expensive combo, but it's 20 life gain, and can still be combined with the non-donate combos above (i.e. Sanguine Blood and/or boon reflection)  
  
First time i saw this card was plaing against someone in EDH, with [Zedruu the Greathearted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zedruu the Greathearted) as a commander. If they don't take the 20 life, you gain a life and a draw each turn.
